channel.title: c2 on dfangx's website
channel.description: Recent content in c2 on dfangx's website

item.title: Day 97, 1 Samuel 1-3
item.description: The birth of Samuel gives a glimpse into the hearts of the people of Israel and the priesthood of God. Hannah was barren, yet persistently prayed to God for a child.

item.title: Day 89,
item.description: After Joshua died, Israel continued their conquest of Canaan. However, there eventually came a time when Israel stopped driving out the Canaanites.

item.title: Day 82, Joshua 1-4
item.description: Joshua officially takes over leadership of Israel. God reiterates what he said before to Joshua, but this time in his new capacity as leader.

item.title: Day 70, Deuteronomy 1-2
item.description: Moses recounts the Journey of Israel after leaving Mount Sinai. When they arrived at the edge of Canaan, God commanded them to go forth and take for themselves the inheritance that he promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

item.title: Titus 2
item.description: In contrast to the people described, Titus is instructed to teach what is in agreement with sound doctrine. He is to teach others in both instruction and example.

item.title: Day 54, Numbers 1-2
item.description: God tells Moses to take a census of Israel. All those who are of fighting age are to be counted. The smallest tribe is Manasseh and the largest is Judah.

item.title: Day 44, Leviticus 1-4
item.description: The laws concerning burnt offerings, peace offerings, and sin offerings all use some sort of animal as the offering. All sacrifices and offerings take place just outside the tent of meeting.

item.title: Day 30, Exodus 1-3
item.description: The children of Israel increased in number and strength. In time, the Egyptians began to fear the Israelites and oppressed them, making them slaves.

item.title: Day 4, Job 1-5
item.description: Job was one of the greatest men in the east. He was blameless and righteous before before God and feared God.

item.title: Galatians 2
item.description: Paul returned to Jerusalem with Barnabas and Titus after 14 years. The purpose of his visit was to ensure that the gospel he had been preaching among the Gentiles was correct.

item.title: Day 1, Genesis 1-3
item.description: The world before creation is described as formless, empty, and dark. Yet, the presence of God is there, it is clear that wherever God is, something is bound to happen.
